title: Mac touch bar stops working properly after window focus change
content:
I'm currently on macOS Catalina 10.15.4 (64 bit), but ever since I upgraded to Catalina, the touch bar support in Firefox started acting up. This is probably not reproducible to other users, as I couldn't find anything on this on the web.

Steps to reproduce: 1. open Firefox (touch bar shows app controls as expected) 2. switch focus to different app 3. switch focus back to Firefox

Expected behaviour: Touch bar shows Firefox app controls

Actual behaviour: Touch bar shows function keys

Reproducible on: regular release - 74.0 beta - 75.0b11 ESR - 68.6.0esr

Not reproducible on: nightly - 76.0a1

Because this is not reproducible on nightly, I suspect this might not be due to my system setup.

I have the touch bar set up this way in system: Touch bar shows: App Controls; Show Control Strip: checked Press Fn Key to: Show F1, F2, etc. Keys

I have tried reinstalling Firefox, deleting my profile, deleting any Firefox/Mozilla related files I could find, but nothing helped. The nightly build is the only way I have found to get rid of this.

Any help is highly appreciated.
creator: bzuco

Even if I choose to see all files and select the backup file, nothing happens, just as if it was empty. But I get no error message.
creator: malborpu

title: DNS resolution takes over 100 ms longer in Firefox than OS DNS resolution. How to improve?
content:
Firefox takes an exceedingly long time to perform DNS resolution. For example when I visit yahoo.com resolving s.yimg.com takes 133 ms.

Resolution takes almost a magnitude longer than it should take. For reference when I use dig:

$ dig s.yimg.com | grep "Query time" ;; Query time: 19 msec

I run dnsmasq on localhost, so whatever isn't already cached only takes about 20 ms on average to resolve.

Why is Firefox taking so long to do DNS resolution and what can I do to fix it?

I've already tried toggling DNS prefetch and disabling IPv6 DNS. No effect.

I'm running the latest Firefox ESR on Linux antix1 4.9.200-antix.1-amd64-smp
creator: firedns

title: Randomly can't create, move, or delete bookmarks on desktop without restarting FF
content: Randomly, though seemingly after closing too many tabs in a short amount of time (but I can't say with certainty that it's related, just that it seems to be the only connection I can see), I suddenly lose the ability to create, delete, or move bookmarks. I can edit pre-existing bookmarks at first, and I can make new bookmarks by pressing the "Bookmark this page" star, but cannot change where that bookmark is placed, and after doing that just once that I can no longer edit any bookmarks. Sync still works and bookmarks can be changed in Firefox mobile and synced with the bugged desktop session. "Verify integrity" shows no problems while this is active, and the browser console does not show any errors while trying to edit bookmarks. No other aspects of the browser seem to be affected. Restarting Firefox fixes the issue. This has only been occurring over the last month and has never occurred that I can remember before this February. Deleting my profile, redoing my bookmarks, and even totally deleting all AppData Folders and my account and starting totally from scratch has not fixed the issue. There are no unusual characters in my user folder's name. Other people who have experienced this bug have had errors show up in verify integrity, so if anyone knows anything else that might cause this I'd appreciate the help.
creator: ringtail.email

title: There's one tab I don't want to keep loading up, but it keeps coming back on launch.
content:
So I have plenty of tabs I want to keep. I'm happy with the way Firefox loads up all my "saved" tabs. As in, when I shut down my PC, they are all there the next time I boot up. However, there is one page that keeps coming back up, even though I have closed it every single time. I can go the whole day, it's not there. Next time I boot up, there it is again.

It's not my homepage, or saved as a bookmark or anything. It was some random link to a Ubisoft free game offer that my friend sent me a couple of weeks ago, and it is infuriating me that I can't work out how to stop it coming back.
creator: chris.hesketh-roberts

title: All dropdown menus are missing in fullscreen mode
content:
Steps to recur: (this bug happens in firefox 69, 70, 71, 72, 73, 74, ...... )

❶ In full-screen mode, right click any tab in the tabbar, try more tabs until the dropdown menu disappears

❷ In full-screen mode, click any item in the bookmarks bar, try more until the dropdown menu disappears

❸ In full-screen mode, click any item in the toolbar, try more until the dropdown menu disappears
